intro: Mormodes greenei, commonly known as the Greene's mormodes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and ecological role in its native habitat.
